me.lucko.helper.command.functional

Interface FunctionalCommandBuilder<T extends CommandSender>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the sender type

    @NonnullByDefault
public interface FunctionalCommandBuilder<T extends CommandSender>
    Functional builder API for Command

      • assertPermission

        default FunctionalCommandBuilder<T> assertPermission(String permission)
        Asserts that the sender has the specified permission, and sends them the default failure message if they don't have permission.
        Parameters:
        permission - the permission to check for
        Returns:
        the builder instance

        Parameters:
        permission - the permission to check for
        failureMessage - the failure message to send if they don't have permission
        Returns:
        the builder instance

      • assertUsage

        default FunctionalCommandBuilder<T> assertUsage(String usage)
        Asserts that the arguments match the given usage string. Arguments should be separated by a " " space. Optional arguments are denoted by wrapping the argument name in square quotes "[ ]" The default failure message is sent if they didn't provide enough arguments.
        Parameters:
        usage - the usage string
        Returns:
        the builder instance

      • assertUsage

        FunctionalCommandBuilder<T> assertUsage(String usage,
                                        String failureMessage)
        Asserts that the arguments match the given usage string. Arguments should be separated by a " " space. Optional arguments are denoted by wrapping the argument name in square quotes "[ ]" The failure message is sent if they didn't provide enough arguments. "{usage}" in this message will be replaced by the usage for the command.
        Parameters:
        usage - the usage string
        failureMessage - the failure message to send if the arguments to not match the usage
        Returns:
        the builder instance

      • assertArgument

        default FunctionalCommandBuilder<T> assertArgument(int index,
                                                   Predicate<String> test)
        Tests a given argument with the provided predicate. The default failure message is sent if the argument does not pass the predicate. If the argument is not present at the given index, null is passed to the predicate.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the argument to test
        test - the test predicate
        Returns:
        the builder instance

      • assertArgument

        FunctionalCommandBuilder<T> assertArgument(int index,
                                           Predicate<String> test,
                                           String failureMessage)
        Tests a given argument with the provided predicate. The failure message is sent if the argument does not pass the predicate. If the argument is not present at the given index, null is passed to the predicate. "{arg}" and "{index}" will be replaced in the failure message with the index and actual argument value respectively.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the argument to test
        test - the test predicate
        failureMessage - the failure message to send if the predicate fails
        Returns:
        the builder instance

      • assertSender

        default FunctionalCommandBuilder<T> assertSender(Predicate<T> test)
        Tests the sender with the provided predicate. The default failure message is sent if the sender does not pass the predicate.
        Parameters:
        test - the test predicate
        Returns:
        the builder instance

      • assertSender

        FunctionalCommandBuilder<T> assertSender(Predicate<T> test,
                                         String failureMessage)
        Tests the sender with the provided predicate. The failure message is sent if the sender does not pass the predicate.
        Parameters:
        test - the test predicate
        failureMessage - the failure message to send if the predicate fails
        Returns:
        the builder instance

      • withCooldown

        default FunctionalCommandBuilder<T> withCooldown(Cooldown cooldown)
        Tests the command attempt against the given cooldown. The default failure message is sent if the command does not pass the cooldown.
        Parameters:
        cooldown - the cooldown
        Returns:
        the builder instance

      • withCooldown

        FunctionalCommandBuilder<T> withCooldown(Cooldown cooldown,
                                         String failureMessage)
        Tests the command attempt against the given cooldown. The default failure message is sent if the command does not pass the cooldown. "{seconds}" is replaced in the failure message by the number of seconds until the cooldown expires
        Parameters:
        cooldown - the cooldown
        failureMessage - the failure message to send if cooldown fails
        Returns:
        the builder instance

      • withCooldown

        default FunctionalCommandBuilder<T> withCooldown(CooldownCollection<T> cooldown)
        Tests the command attempt against the given cooldown. The default failure message is sent if the command does not pass the cooldown.
        Parameters:
        cooldown - the cooldown
        Returns:
        the builder instance

      • withCooldown

        FunctionalCommandBuilder<T> withCooldown(CooldownCollection<T> cooldown,
                                         String failureMessage)
        Tests the command attempt against the given cooldown. The default failure message is sent if the command does not pass the cooldown. "{seconds}" is replaced in the failure message by the number of seconds until the cooldown expires
        Parameters:
        cooldown - the cooldown
        failureMessage - the failure message to send if cooldown fails
        Returns:
        the builder instance

      • handler

        Command handler(FunctionalCommandHandler<T> handler)
        Builds this FunctionalCommandBuilder into a Command instance. The command will not be registered with the server until Command.register(ExtendedJavaPlugin, String...) is called.
        Parameters:
        handler - the command handler
        Returns:
        the command instance.
